page.title: 19HISTORIC AREAS OF CHARLBURY
page.content: This area has many old buildings.When Queen Victoria came to visit Charlbury in 1886 she had a Jubilee Fountain built.It stands on the end of the Playing Close.It looked much the same as it does now except there was a lamp on top which was taken off because people threw stones at it. Round the Wychwood countryside there are a lot of ancient burial grounds.The oldest house in Charlbury is Armada Cottage which was built in 1587.It is situated in Thames Street.The Bell Hotel in Church Street was built in 1700.The Museum was opened in 1952. It is next to the Corner House and has many old objects relating to the area. Cornbury Park is owned by Lord Rotherwick and has many landscaped gardens.The Charlbury Society was founded in 1949 to administer the museum and other historical aspects.
